comments:
During a debug session, jvm often is disconnected and application continues to run in nondebug mode. I am running this on a dual core box and happens more often while there are running threads in suspended mode. There were at least two distinct cases where disconnect happened and adding the stack traces for both cases below:



Message:Internal error logged from JDI Debug:

Exception Stack Trace:

Our test suite seems to have similar random diconnects. It only seems to happen on Windows, and we're not sure why.

The fix to bug 137926 may reduce the occurrence of this. We don't have a concrete explanation for this, but it seems that reducing the multi-threaded requests against the target reduces the occurrence of this problem.
Do you see this happen in 3.2 RC2?
Still wondering if you see this in RC2 or one of the latest integration builds such as I20060504-0920 or later?
I've been using RC2 for a week or so and haven't seen this so far.
Thanks, marking as works for me. Please re-open if the problem occurrs again.

I don't think this is resolved. At first it seemed it didn't occur again but actually i still see it. I can't really tell under what conditions it happens but every once in a while it does happen. 
I tried with RC4 but it is worse. Not only it disconnects more often but leaves the platform in an unusable state with the only solution being a restart. In RC4 the cause doesn't even register in the error log thus i can not post it here but it gives me a summary in the variables view with the same message:

com.sun.jdi.VMDisconnectedException: Got IOException from Virtual Machine
*** Bug 144430 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I still have the problem since eclipse 3.2M4 to 3.3 M2 on debian or ubuntu 6.06 linux distribution.
i try several sun official jvm from jdk1.5.0 to jdk1.5.0_08 (downloaded on sun website)
To avoid the problem my dev team is using eclispe 3.2M3 and we will not upgrade eclipse since this bug is not fixed. This bug is 6 month old and i am thinking about to use another IDE...
Same here. This bug is productivity killer. It is rather amusing to other IDE users here that we eclipse users have this problem.I think the priority of this should be elevated urgently.

It is interesting that more than one person experiences the disconnect problem when generating hover help. I have not been able to reproduce the problem yet (i.e. by invoking hover). If someone has a reliable test case, please attach.

For those seeing this problem on linux, please see bug 153458 to ensure you are using compatible versions of VM and OS. Both Olivier Martin and Vito Impagliazzo have stated that the problem is not happening for them with new workspaces. Ilker Gunor, does this probem happen for you in a new workspace?
Ilker, your .log shows you are using 1.5.0_06 to run your host IDE, are you also debugging your target applications on that same VM/version?
Does anyone know what they were hovering over, or what kind of logical structure they were displaying when the disconnects happened?

I am using 1.5.0_06 both for launching Eclipse as well as debugging my target application. The usual scenario when this happens is with some complex or deep data structure in the variables area being displayed while stepping in/over code. However, I have come across cases when it simply disconnected without me even hovering over variables or stack frames. I will try to be more specific if I can spot a pattern.
Fresh workspace created with newer versions sounds like an option worth trying.
I will try that. Is there a recommended version of VM? Thanks.

I have recreated my workspace and projects from scratch.Using version 3.3M3 with Sun JVM 1.5.0_10. I tried it with earlier versions as well. Same version of JVM to run host IDE as well as the target app.

The problem is,although not as frequent,still happening.Upon disconnect from the VM,the debug view also reports that many of the threads in the process were terminated while some others were not.My suspended thread at the time of disconnect was not terminated,so I still tried clicking on the various levels in the stack frame.It seems like it remembers the list of variables at that position,most likely due to internal caching of the list of variables in the frame.However,it quickly goes back to VMDisconnected error mode,which I believe is happening when it is trying to actually query the values for those variables.At least that's my speculation on it.Whether it means anything for this bug or makes any difference,I don't know.

One thing I realized is that,it most often happens while there is a list or tree or map or some other sort of "deep" and "nested" data structure in the stack frame.Could it perhaps have something to do with trying to display these structures in the variables view?
See bug 171075. We may have a winner...
I've posted a test replacement plug-in on bug 171075, compatible with 3.2.2.

Marking as a dup of bug 171075. Fix is available in latest 3.2.2 build and in 3.3.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 171075 ***
Updated to 3.3M5 and since then haven't seen this happen again. Thanks.
